abstract: The downgrades of Bank of America, Citigroup and Wells Fargo were driven by the conclusion that the government was less likely to provide support for a faltering bank.
snippet: The downgrades of Bank of America, Citigroup and Wells Fargo were driven by the conclusion that the government was less likely to provide support for a faltering bank.
lead_paragraph: Moody’s cut its credit ratings Wednesday on three large banks — Bank of America, Citigroup and Wells Fargo — underscoring the challenges the sector still faces three years after the onset of the financial crisis.

headline.main: Moody’s Downgrades Credit Ratings of Three Large Banks
headline.print_headline: Moody’s Downgrades Credit Ratings of Three Large Banks

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
